summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between law enforcement personnel discussing interviews with Jeffrey Epstein's prior employees. It details attempts to locate and interview a former maid and a former chief engineer, and includes notes from the interview with the engineer regarding his long-term employment, observations of massage rooms and women at Epstein's properties, and his working conditions.

persons.name: Natividad Ruperez
persons.context: A prior employee of Epstein who worked as a house maid for approximately 15 years. Law enforcement attempted to interview her but she was in the Philippines.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. His properties, staff, and alleged activities involving massage rooms and women are the subject of the employee interviews.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who hired the chief engineer to work for Epstein at his New York residence.

persons.name: Newyn De La Cruz
persons.context: Identified by the former chief engineer as the person who succeeded him in that role for Epstein.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.role: Previous owner of Epstein's NY property
persons.context: Mentioned as the prior owner of the New York address where Epstein later lived.

persons.name: Paul
persons.role: Detective, NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The author of the initial email requesting assistance with interviewing Epstein's prior employees about their knowledge of activities at his New York home.

persons.name: Richard
persons.role: Prior New York employee of Epstein
persons.context: Another prior employee of Epstein in New York that law enforcement was attempting to locate for an interview.

connections.description: Ruperez worked as a house maid for Epstein for approximately 15 years.
Maxwell was involved in hiring staff, specifically the chief engineer, for Epstein's residence.
De La Cruz succeeded the interviewed engineer as Chief Engineer for Epstein.
Wexner previously owned the New York address that Epstein later lived in.

events.title: Interview with former Epstein Chief Engineer
events.description: Law enforcement interviews a man who worked as Epstein's Chief Engineer from 1995 to 2014. He discusses his hiring, work at various Epstein properties, observations of massage rooms and women, his distant relationship with Epstein, and reasons for leaving. He is served with a Federal Grand Jury subpoena.

events.title: Law enforcement coordination on employee interviews
events.description: Detective Paul emails colleagues requesting assistance in interviewing prior Epstein employees to ask about their knowledge of Epstein, massage rooms, and girls coming and going at his New York home.

locations: New York City (Epstein's residence, previously owned by Wexner)
Epstein's private island (location of one of his properties)
New Mexico (location of an Epstein property)
Nassau County (possible residence of a prior employee)
keyFacts: A former chief engineer for Epstein worked for him from 1995 to 2014 and confirmed the presence of massage rooms in all of Epstein's properties, noting he saw many women coming and going.
The engineer stated he was hired through Ghislaine Maxwell to work at Epstein's New York residence and that Epstein and his staff kept him excluded from meetings.
Law enforcement was actively trying to locate and interview at least three prior employees (a maid, the chief engineer, and an employee named Richard) in July 2019 as part of the investigation.
One employee, Natividad Ruperez, had worked for Epstein for about 15 years but was in the Philippines and could not be interviewed.
The New York residence where the alleged abuse occurred was previously owned by Leslie Wexner before Epstein lived there.
